WordCreate.definition: Lasting for a very short time.
The occurrence and development of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way.
A typical example or pattern of something; a model.
Done merely as a duty; performed without interest or enthusiasm.
Overwhelm (someone) with things or people to be dealt with.
The capacity to recover quickly from difficulties; toughness.
Evoke or draw out (a response, answer, or fact) from someone.
Make less severe, serious, or painful.
A person new to or inexperienced in a field or situation.
Engaged in, reflecting deep or serious thought.
Understood or implied without being stated.
Given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior.
Giving a lot of information clearly and in a few words; brief but comprehensive.

SentenceCreate.text: Mobile phones are becoming increasingly ubiquitous in the modern world.
The beauty of a sunset is sadly ephemeral.
It was pure serendipity that I ran into my old friend at the airport.
She has a truly benevolent nature, always helping those in need.
The internet has caused a major paradigm shift in how we communicate.
He gave a perfunctory nod, clearly not interested in the details.
After the storm, we were inundated with calls for help.
Her amazing resilience allowed her to bounce back quickly after the loss.
The journalist tried to elicit a response from the politician.
They are hoping to mitigate the impact of the new regulations.
As a novice programmer, I have a lot to learn.
She looked pensive, staring out the window at the rain.
We had a tacit agreement that we wouldn't discuss the past.
His capricious changes of mood made it difficult to work with him.
Please make your report concise and to the point.
